ranked.title: ReAct: Synergizing Reasoning and Acting in Language Models

ranked.reason: MemGPT's concept of LLMs as operating systems suggests advanced interaction and management, which is crucial for sophisticated intent understanding and agent adaptation.

ranked.title: RAP: Retrieval-Augmented Planning with Contextual Memory for Multimodal LLM Agents
ranked.reason: Retrieval-augmented planning and contextual memory are key components for agents to effectively process and act upon complex prompts, making this a strong candidate for understanding ambiguous user intents.

ranked.title: Contextual Experience Replay for Self-Improvement of Language Agents
ranked.reason: Self-improvement through contextual experience replay is directly applicable to enhancing an agent's ability to understand and adapt to user prompts, especially ambiguous ones, through learning from past interactions.

ranked.title: Synapse: Trajectory-as-Exemplar Prompting with Memory for Computer Control
ranked.reason: This paper focuses on memory and prompting strategies for agent control, which are essential for interpreting user instructions and generating appropriate responses or actions, particularly in ambiguous situations.

ranked.reason: Reflective memory management and personalization are vital for agents to understand nuanced user intents over time, especially in dialogues where ambiguity is common.

ranked.reason: An OS for memory-augmented generation implies sophisticated handling of information and context, which is crucial for understanding and adapting to user intents.

ranked.reason: Personalization and cognitive dual-memory suggest an agent that can better infer user intent based on individual interaction history, directly supporting the target's goal.

ranked.reason: Exploratory learning and reflection are key to an agent's ability to handle uncertainty and refine its understanding, which is important for ambiguous prompts.

ranked.reason: Training retrievers for reasoning tasks implies improving an agent's ability to process information and make logical deductions, which can aid in clarifying ambiguous prompts.

ranked.title: Thinking vs. Doing: Agents that Reason by Scaling Test-Time Interaction
ranked.reason: Scaling test-time interaction for reasoning suggests an agent that learns and adapts during interaction, which is beneficial for understanding dynamic or ambiguous user prompts.

ranked.title: MEM1: Learning to Synergize Memory and Reasoning for Efficient Long-Horizon Agents
ranked.reason: Synergizing memory and reasoning is fundamental for agents to handle complex and potentially ambiguous instructions effectively.

ranked.title: MapAgent: Trajectory-Constructed Memory-Augmented Planning for Mobile Task Automation
ranked.reason: Memory-augmented planning is relevant for agents to execute tasks based on instructions, and improving this can help with intent understanding, especially in complex scenarios.

ranked.reason: Managing memory for dynamic tool calling in multi-turn conversations directly relates to an agent's ability to interpret and respond to user needs, including those with ambiguous prompts.

ranked.title: Self-evolving Agents with reflective and memory-augmented abilities
ranked.reason: Self-evolution through reflection and memory augmentation suggests an agent that can improve its understanding of prompts and adapt its behavior over time.

ranked.title: HiAgent: Hierarchical Working Memory Management for Solving Long-Horizon Agent Tasks with Large Language Model
ranked.reason: Hierarchical memory management is important for agents to process complex instructions, and can contribute to better understanding of user intent, especially in long or intricate dialogues.

ranked.title: MemoryBank: Enhancing Large Language Models with Long-Term Memory
ranked.reason: Long-term memory is crucial for agents to build context and understand user intentions consistently over extended interactions, which can help with ambiguous prompts.

ranked.title: Human-inspired Episodic Memory for Infinite Context LLMs
ranked.reason: Episodic memory can help agents recall specific past interactions and user preferences, aiding in the interpretation of ambiguous prompts and providing more personalized responses.

ranked.title: LongMemEval: Benchmarking Chat Assistants on Long-Term Interactive Memory
ranked.reason: Evaluating long-term interactive memory is directly relevant to how well agents can understand context and user intent across multiple turns, which is key for handling ambiguity.

ranked.title: Evaluating Very Long-Term Conversational Memory of LLM Agents
ranked.reason: Similar to LongMemEval, this focuses on long-term memory, which is essential for agents to maintain context and understand subtle or ambiguous user intents.

ranked.title: MemAgent: Reshaping Long-Context LLM with Multi-Conv RL-based Memory Agent
ranked.reason: A memory agent focused on long context and reinforcement learning can adapt to and understand complex user needs, including ambiguous ones.

ranked.title: A Real-World WebAgent with Planning, Long Context Understanding, and Program Synthesis
ranked.reason: Long context understanding and planning are vital for agents to process complex instructions and infer user intent, especially in real-world applications.

ranked.title: Mind2Web: Towards a Generalist Agent for the Web
ranked.reason: Developing a generalist web agent implies capabilities for understanding a wide range of user intents and adapting to diverse web interactions, which includes handling ambiguity.

ranked.title: M+: Extending MemoryLLM with Scalable Long-Term Memory
ranked.reason: Extending long-term memory directly supports an agent's ability to retain context and understand user intent over extended interactions.

ranked.title: Mem0: Building Production-Ready AI Agents with Scalable Long-Term Memory
ranked.reason: Focus on scalable long-term memory for AI agents is relevant to building robust systems that can maintain context and understand user needs, even with ambiguous prompts.

ranked.title: Learning Wisdom from Errors: Promoting LLM's Continual Relation Learning through Exploiting Error Cases
ranked.reason: Learning from errors is a form of adaptation and self-improvement that can help agents refine their understanding of prompts, especially those that were initially misunderstood.

ranked.title: In-Context Principle Learning from Mistakes
ranked.reason: Learning from mistakes in-context can lead to agents that are more adept at understanding and correcting misinterpretations of user prompts.

ranked.title: Investigate-Consolidate-Exploit: A General Strategy for Inter-Task Agent Self-Evolution
ranked.reason: Self-evolution strategies can enable agents to adapt their understanding and processing of prompts over time, improving their ability to handle ambiguity.

ranked.title: Learn-by-interact: A Data-Centric Framework for Self-Adaptive Agents in Realistic Environments
ranked.reason: Self-adaptive agents that learn by interacting are better equipped to handle diverse and potentially ambiguous user inputs in real-world scenarios.

ranked.title: Memp: Exploring Agent Procedural Memory
ranked.reason: Procedural memory in agents can contribute to more consistent and effective task execution based on instructions, which indirectly supports intent understanding.

ranked.title: Agent KB: Leveraging Cross-Domain Experience for Agentic Problem Solving
ranked.reason: Leveraging cross-domain experience can help an agent generalize its understanding and problem-solving abilities, making it more robust to novel or ambiguous prompts.

ranked.title: Autonomous Evaluation and Refinement of Digital Agents
ranked.reason: Autonomous refinement of agents is key to improving their performance, including their ability to accurately interpret user intents, even when they are ambiguous.

ranked.title: Self-Refine: Iterative Refinement with Self-Feedback
ranked.reason: Iterative refinement with self-feedback can help an agent improve its understanding of prompts by correcting its own interpretations, which is crucial for ambiguous inputs.

ranked.title: Agent Workflow Memory
ranked.reason: Workflow memory can help agents maintain context and coherence in executing tasks based on instructions, contributing to better intent understanding.
